intro: Ferula multifida, commonly known as the Persian cow's milk plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. The plant is characterized by its branched, hollow stems and pinnately divided leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
